No need to filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l0qd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m97f","text":"- Diluted Retronectin  (12.5 μg/mL diluted in 1x D-PBS and aliquotes stored at -20C until use).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sp9a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6nao","text":"- 1000x human IL-2 stock  (50,000 IU/mL in 1x D-PBS; reconstituted per manufacturer). hIL-2 is cross-reactive and is more economical.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fgb6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5moqu","text":"- 1000x human IL-15 stock (10,000 IU/mL in 1x D-PBS; reconstituted per manufacturer). hIL-15 is cross-reactive and is more economical.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frp6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76ho6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9hgbn","text":"This protocol will guide you through the process of how our group (Riddell Lab, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center) generates murine CD8+ CAR T cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77nt2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8n1r4","text":"We normally begin this protocol on Monday, transduce the cells on Thursday, and immunophenotype them by the following Monday. The CAR T cells can then be used in standard cell-based assays (e.g. cytotoxicity, cell proliferation, or cytokine production) or for in vivo studies. See the following two protocols for details:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bck4g","text":"_ 51Cr Release Cytotoxicity Assay for murine CAR T cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":2,"length":54}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ifvi","text":"_ Standard cell-based assays for cytokine release and cellular proliferation of murine CAR T cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":97}],"data":{}},{"key":"cc0ou","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16opp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m49b","text":"The protocol will hopefully elaborate on the usual methods-section write-up that reads something like this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qg97","text":"\nMurine T cell viral transduction and adoptive transfer: CD8+ T cells were negatively selected (Stem Cell) from spleen and peripheral lymph nodes of 6–8 week-old CD45.1 mice, and stimulated with 1 mg/ml plate-bound anti-CD3 (145-2C11) and anti-CD28 (37.51) for 18-20 h at 37°C 5% CO2 in complete RPMI (RPMI-1640, 10% heat-inactivated FBS, 1 mM HEPES, 100 U/mL penicillin/streptomycin, 1 mM sodium pyruvate, and 50 μM b-mercaptoethanol) supplemented with 50 U/mL human IL-2 (IL-2+, Peprotech). Retrovirus was captured for 2 h at 2560rcf at 32°C onto wells pre-coated with RetroNectin (Takara) and CD8+ T cells were added at 1×106 cells/mL in IL-2+ complete RPMI and mouse T-activator Dynabeads (ThermoFisher) at 1:1 ratio. Plates were centrifuged at 800rcf for 30 min at 32°C and incubated overnight. T cells were then resuspended in 1.5x volume of IL-2+ media and incubated for an additional 24 h. T cells were resuspended in 3x volume of IL-15+ media and incubated for an additional 48 h. Activator beads were removed and transduction efficiency was determined by flow cytometry. CAR T cells were prepared for infusion by resuspending at the indicated number of CAR T cells per 100 µL serum-free RPMI-1640 and kept on ice prior to adoptive transfer. 6-8 week-old C57BL/6J female mice were pre-conditioned as indicated and 6 h later injected intravenously with 3×106 CAR T cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kfkn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C93BAB30407B11EE9F18D9ECC15C3971","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/51cr-release-cytotoxicity-assay-for-murine-car-t-c-n92ldmm2ol5b/v1"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1C2E68F0407C11EE9F18D9ECC15C3971","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/standard-cell-based-assays-for-cytokine-release-an-dm6gp3358vzp/v1"}}}}

ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"2e0kr","text":"The protocol involves harvesting secondary lymphoid tissue from mice, which must be conducted only following approval from the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3d82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6frm","text":"CD4 T cells can be isolated to generate CD4+ CAR T cells instead of CD8 equivalents, and the protocol can be used to engineer murine T cells by viral transduction to express proteins other than CARs as long as these proteins are encoded in a retroviral vector.  Viral production cells other than plat-Es can be used as long as vectors encoding the gag, pol, env genes are included in the transfection workflow. Transfection reagents other than Xfect can be used according to their respective manufacturer's protocols. Lastly, large-batch retroviral supernatants can be generated in advance and snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen and placed at -80C long-term storage, instead of the fresh supernatants being generated as described below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64qe6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aimo","text":"Large-batch production of murine CAR-encoding retroviruses carries the advantage of allowing for the careful titration of the dilution required for the transduction to achieve a desired transduction efficiency by the end of the culturing period. For example, if 50% CAR+ T cell cultures are desired, a pilot study with various dilutions of the freshly thawed supernatant can be performed to make that determination. The remainder of that retroviral sup lot can diluted at the same ratio every time a scalable CAR T cell transduction is performed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"55tpm","text":"Following the overnight incubation, exchange the transfection medium (on day 3) with fresh pre-warmed cDMEM and incubate the transfected plat-E culture for additional 24-30 hours. Harvest the supernatant (on day 4) and filter through 0.45 μm. Collected retroviral supernatant can be snap-frozen and placed at -80 °C long-term. Otherwise, the retroviral sup is ready for immediate use to transduce murine T cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmehd","text":"       ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rg2h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dne6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4f8b","text":"It is critical to use 0.45 μm filters and not 0.22 μm, as the latter affects the viral yield.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fv71p","text":"Mechanically dissociate spleen and LNs by repeatedly pressing and grinding them between the frosted surfaces of two glass slides. Collect the dissociated tissue in a new 6-well-plate well with fresh mTCM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eekpc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ov6p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4im6b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"29bk6","text":"Proper mechanical dissociation of the lymph nodes and spleen is vital to an efficient cell isolation. Rinse the frosted slides off well with mTCM between groups. Splenocytes are very fragile; once the organ is crushed, rinse the slides and move on. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9vab6","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8pra7","text":"It's very easy to lose lymph nodes in the slurry of grinding, Use separate plates for 1) collecting lymph nodes and 2) grinding and rinsing the frosted slides.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
